channel.title: RS classic scripts
channel.description: any1 know were to download the rs classic scripts or can some1 please make me a rs classic autominer/banker/fatigue restore or a autotheiver thanks :)

item.title: RS classic scripts
item.dc:creator: @x0x0 x0x0
item.description:
@x0x0 wrote:

I used [quote=“Cazax-, post:7, topic:257378”]Oh i’m sorry, I was thinking about SCAR 2.03+… Anyways I don’t think there is an updated RSC script.

EDIT: Lol i’m not a moron, from freddy’s page:

[QUOTE]The beginnings of SCAR

RS2 was finally released, and Kaitnieks created another CDE. This one was nothing like AutoRune as it could not directly communicate with the server. The new program was a simple color clicker. But because it had the same open design as AutoRune, users were able to create their own scripts. Kaitnieks named this CDE SCAR (Shite compared to AutoRune). Although Kaitnieks didn’t know it yet, SCAR would be one of the longest standing RuneScape bots.

SCAR was being constantly updated with more and more features including text, bitmap and DTM recognition. Thousands of free scripts were available to download and use. The wide variety of scripts attracted hundreds of players to SCAR.

Some other bots were also released around that time. Some of these were RSBot (recreated), SBot, Aryan, along few others. Most of them died off after a while.

Kaitnieks eventually decided to leave the RuneScape scene. Before he left, he published the source code to SCAR. Customized clients started becoming a big thing at the time, and people began creating their own RuneScape servers. Still, SCAR was the last standing macro left for RuneScape.

Kaitnieks.com closed down a while after, as Kaitnieks became a father. The SCAR community scattered. For a long time, people did not know where to go. They continued to use SCAR as best as they could, but it was getting behind. It had not yet been updated since version 2.03 and was heavily outdated.

But, just before Kaitnieks.com closed down… [/QUOTE][/quote]I used SCAR before RS2 was released…

Read full topic

item.title: RS classic scripts
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

[quote=“Greg the Xeno, post:6, topic:257378”]From www.katients.com/scar/faq2

[quote]
1.8. Q. What is Silent Mouse?

A. If the ‘Silent Mouse’ option is on, whenever a script makes the mouse move and/or click, your mouse pointer will not actually move. This is highly detectable in RS 2, but was great for RS Classic, because you could run several autoing programs at once.

[/quote][/quote]

haha omg, my Scar FAQ still exists!!!

as for RSC scripts… they do exist… but it would be hard to find good ones that work, since its not easy to get an acount that can play RSC to test them on

Read full topic

item.title: RS classic scripts
item.dc:creator: @Cazax1 Cazax-
item.description:
@Cazax1 wrote:

Oh i’m sorry, I was thinking about SCAR 2.03+… Anyways I don’t think there is an updated RSC script.

EDIT: Lol i’m not a moron, from freddy’s page:

[QUOTE]The beginnings of SCAR

RS2 was finally released, and Kaitnieks created another CDE. This one was nothing like AutoRune as it could not directly communicate with the server. The new program was a simple color clicker. But because it had the same open design as AutoRune, users were able to create their own scripts. Kaitnieks named this CDE SCAR (Shite compared to AutoRune). Although Kaitnieks didn’t know it yet, SCAR would be one of the longest standing RuneScape bots.

SCAR was being constantly updated with more and more features including text, bitmap and DTM recognition. Thousands of free scripts were available to download and use. The wide variety of scripts attracted hundreds of players to SCAR.

Some other bots were also released around that time. Some of these were RSBot (recreated), SBot, Aryan, along few others. Most of them died off after a while.

Kaitnieks eventually decided to leave the RuneScape scene. Before he left, he published the source code to SCAR. Customized clients started becoming a big thing at the time, and people began creating their own RuneScape servers. Still, SCAR was the last standing macro left for RuneScape.

Kaitnieks.com closed down a while after, as Kaitnieks became a father. The SCAR community scattered. For a long time, people did not know where to go. They continued to use SCAR as best as they could, but it was getting behind. It had not yet been updated since version 2.03 and was heavily outdated.

But, just before Kaitnieks.com closed down… [/QUOTE]

Read full topic

item.title: RS classic scripts
item.dc:creator: @Greg_the_Xeno Greg the Xeno
item.description:
@Greg_the_Xeno wrote:

Cazax-:

There aren’t any RSC scripts.

SCAR came out after AutoRune died. SCAR was originally for rsc. Don’t be retarded, RSC is an old game. Moron.

From www.katients.com/scar/faq2

1.8. Q. What is Silent Mouse?

A. If the ‘Silent Mouse’ option is on, whenever a script makes the mouse move and/or click, your mouse pointer will not actually move. This is highly detectable in RS 2, but was great for RS Classic, because you could run several autoing programs at once.

Read full topic
